intro: Aylostera gavazzii, commonly known as the Sicilian rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color, blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Aylostera gavazzii is often found growing on rocky slopes and in dry, well-drained soils.
